stream_context.summary: Asset-integration and bug-fixing session focused on the newly-revamped “Wario’s Wildlife World” (the zoo course) plus quick passes on the aquarium, Antarctic plane mini-game and assorted objects while laying groundwork for upcoming multiplayer and external play-tests.

development_findings.summary: Kaze prepared code hooks for future multiplayer, implemented minor performance gains and "smoother transitions" by copying radius-scaling code.
development_findings.quote: I have prepared a lot of stuff that we need to do in order to get multiplayer in... we have smoother transitions now.

development_findings.summary: Monthly single-course public test builds will return; each ROM will contain one polished level so gameplay can be evaluated in isolation.
development_findings.quote: I think we're gonna bring back monthly course testing, where a player will just get to test one course at a time.

development_findings.summary: Major visual overhaul of the zoo level by Biobak: new bricks, bushes, benches, zip-lines, teddy bear, signage, lighting and reduced vertex counts; Kaze adjusted UVs, wall heights and collision to match.
‘Butt print’ decal for ground-pound/slide finalized at 12×12 transparent i4 – Zeina supplied symmetrical art, Kaze integrated.
development_findings.quote: I'm making a butt print because we need one.

development_findings.summary: Aquarium re-work: fixed Unagi transparency, added reflective glass material, metal catwalks, treasure-room chest with custom coin-pile CI8 texture; punch-front interaction coded.
Behaviour-script crash fixed: object field 0x3E overwriting pointer; Kaze shifted offset to 0x40 to restore NPC dialogue.
development_findings.quote: I see what's happening… setting that value might cause the behavior script pointer to just become an invalid value, which would cause the bug that just happened.

development_findings.summary: Cheep-Cheep model merged to two textures; Kaze added dynamic color tint and random size offsets for variety.
Removed unnecessary culling flags and merged materials (e.g., Chain Chomp) to cut texture loads and prevent Fast64 render bugs.
Antarctic plane mini-game tweaks in progress: fog mismatch, scrolling water, Cheep-Cheep spawn offset; timer debate (45-sec record vs. 1:15 suggestion).
Engine, tools and final hack will be completely open-source; Kaze emphasizes one-ROM solution for multiplayer instead of a separate build.
development_findings.quote: Making it a separate ROM kind of feels like cheating to me – I want it all in one ROM.

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s design philosophy rejects modern "frustration-minimized" games; he embraces risk and the possibility that players get stuck.
context_findings.quote: Modern video games are just frustration minimized… I want my games to take the risks of just like, oh there's a risk something doesn't work out for the player.

context_findings.summary: Maintains an anti-parasocial stance with audience; values blunt feedback over polite praise.
context_findings.quote: If your level is shit and people tell you it's shit, you should still be happy… that's the most useful thing you can get.

context_findings.summary: Uses a cheap-mouse ‘pipeline’: always keeps a $10 spare to swap instantly when one fails – illustrates thrifty, practical work style.
context_findings.quote: I always have one in store… I call this pipelining mice.

context_findings.summary: Open about not performing charity tie-ins merely for optics, preferring authenticity.
context_findings.quote: I don't really care about charity, so I'm not even going to make a video pretending about it.

biobak.summary: Delivered massive zoo asset pack (textures, models, lighting) and additional object re-works (boat, cannon, chain-chomp gate, tables); shaved vertices and combined materials for performance.
Provided detailed change-log with comedic signage and narrative beats (e.g., "please feed the animals" gag).

zeina.summary: Supplied corrected symmetrical 12×12 butt-print texture; collaborated live on dimensions.
Animating Mario’s shuffle dance using Yoshi Milkman’s IK rig; new per-frame streaming system lets her create unlimited-length animations.
zeina.quote: You can make it as long as you want… we’re basically loading individual frames of the animation into memory.

zeina.summary: Playful on-stream dynamic with Kaze: brief art sketch bit while he took a break; evidences relaxed team atmosphere.

key_stories.title: Zoo Level Reinvention
key_stories.summary: Biobak overhauled the entire zoo environment, replacing nearly every texture and prop. Kaze spent the stream integrating assets, fixing UVs, collision and giving design feedback.
key_stories.challenge: Original zoo looked flat and outdated; new assets risked breaking collision, render modes and performance.
key_stories.process: Biobak produced a detailed change-log and asset pack; Kaze imported, debugged Fast64 quirks, removed culling flags and adjusted code for new object sizes.
key_stories.outcome: Level now feels "so much more alive" with darker shading, interactive signage and optimized geometry, though Kaze still must rebuild collision and tweaked gameplay elements (Chomp interactions, water color).
key_stories.key_quote: The level looks so much more alive now – I like it a lot.

key_stories.title: Chest Crash Debug
key_stories.summary: NPC dialogue and gate interactions suddenly broke after code refactor.
key_stories.challenge: Setting damage/current value at object offset 0x3E overwrote the behaviour-script pointer, causing softlocks.
key_stories.process: Kaze used debugger to trace invalid jump table, identified memory overlap, shifted field to 0x40 and recompiled.
key_stories.outcome: Game stability restored; illustrates perils of deep engine edits.
key_stories.key_quote: It was setting the interact status to 0 – that explains the crash.

key_stories.title: Unlimited Mario Dance
key_stories.summary: Zeina is crafting a crowd-pleasing Mario shuffle for a secret in-game spot.
key_stories.challenge: Standard N64 animation memory limits are tight.
key_stories.process: Kaze implemented per-frame streaming so the game loads animation frames on demand; told Zeina length is now unrestricted.
key_stories.outcome: Creative freedom unlocked; long, humorous dance planned.
key_stories.key_quote: Because we're streaming frames, as long as there's cart space you can just keep going.

open_questions.context: Kaze ‘prepared a lot of stuff’ but no technical details; insists on single-ROM solution.
questions: Will multiplayer be splitscreen, alternating camera, or online?

open_questions.context: Kaze announced revival with one tester per course but hasn’t defined criteria.

open_questions.context: Biobak’s change-log suggests 45-second and no-damage trophies; Kaze unsure about timer and control tolerance.
questions: What final target times feel ‘challenging but fair’?
